00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Using QueryPath.
00004  *
00005  * This file contains an example of how QueryPath can be used
00006  * to generate XML.
00007  *
00008  * QueryPath's ability to handle arbitrary XML comes in handy. Fragments of HTML
00009  * can be composed as external XML documents, and then inserted selectively into
00010  * an HTML document as needed. Just remember: Ever XML document -- even just a 
00011  * string -- needs to begin with the XML declaration:
00012  * <code>
00013  * <? xml version="1.0"?>
00014  * </code>
00015  * (A space was inserted above to prevent the documentation renderer from 
00016  * misinterpreting it.)
00017  * 
00018  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00019  * @license LGPL The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license.
00020  */
00021  
00022 require_once '../src/QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00023 
00024 
00025 // Create a new XML document wrapped in a QueryPath.
00026 // By default, it will point to the root element,
00027 // <author/>
00028 $record = qp('<?xml version="1.0"?><author></author>')
00029   // Add a new last name inside of author.
00030   ->append('<lastName>Dostoyevsky</lastName>')
00031   // Select all of the children of <author/>. In this case,
00032   // that is <lastName/>
00033   ->children()
00034   // Oh, wait... we wanted last name to be inside of a <name/> 
00035   // element. Use wrap to wrap the current element in something:
00036   ->wrap('<name/>')
00037   // And before last name, we want to add first name.
00038   ->before('<firstName/>')
00039   // Select first name
00040   ->prev()
00041   // Set the text of first name
00042   ->text('Fyodor')
00043   // And then after first name, add the patronymic
00044   ->after('<patronymic>Fyodorovich</patronymic>')
00045   // Now go back to the root element, the top of the document.
00046   ->top()
00047   // Add another tag -- origin.
00048   ->append('<origin>Russia</origin>')
00049   // turn the QueryPath contents back into a string. Since we are 
00050   // at the top of the document, the whole document will be converted
00051   // to a string.
00052   ->xml();
00053 
00054 // Print our results.
00055 print $record;
